sentences.english: The theory is based on the assumption of labor homogeneity.
sentences.chinese: 劳动价值论是建立在劳动同质性假设基础上的。

sentences.english: Calling two events by the same name does not make them homogeneous.
sentences.chinese: 用同一个名字来称呼两个事件不会让它们同质化。

sentences.english: Using WCR lines with CMS cytoplasm as female parent to develop new restorer lines by backcrossing.
sentences.chinese: 以同质广亲和恢复系为母本转育新的恢复系。

sentences.english: One such need is to develop global homogenous capabilities to provide greater flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 这样的需求是开发全球同质能力来提供更大的灵活性。

sentences.english: Since the massive homogeneous news has been the treasure house of language materials in studying synonymous texts.
sentences.chinese: 大量存在的同质新闻是同义语篇研究的语料宝库。

sentences.english: The mistaken view of China as a homogeneous land goes back hundreds of years.
sentences.chinese: 这种认为中国同质化的错误观点可以追溯到几百年前。

sentences.english: The physical motivations with high spin isomer beams were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 论述了高自旋同质异能态束流的物理意义。

sentences.english: The homogeneity and heterogeneity of Chinese and English body-part metaphorization is analyzed by examples.
sentences.chinese: 论文中举例分析了英汉人体隐喻的同质性和异质性。

sentences.english: Amoebae consist of just one more or less homogeneous cell.
sentences.chinese: 阿米巴只含有一种大体同质的细胞。

sentences.english: I'm obsessed with things that are distinctly analogue.
sentences.chinese: 我很迷恋那些带有明显同质化的东西。

sentences.english: Subthreshold depression is homogeneous with depression.
sentences.chinese: 阈下抑郁与抑郁症具有同质性。

sentences.english: This study indicate that the positive and negative di-mon mating hybrids are homogenous heterokaryons in Lentinula edodes .
sentences.chinese: 本研究表明，香菇双单杂交后代是同质异核体。

sentences.english: But for many goods there is a demand for homogenization from producers or consumers.
sentences.chinese: 但对许多商品来说生产者或消费者需要商品的同质化。

sentences.english: The main reason for slicing the clay is to homogenize the distribution of soft and dry clay.
sentences.chinese: 主要原因切片粘土是同质化的分布和干软粘土。

sentences.english: They are reducible to the sameness or homogeneity of a self-concerned individual.
sentences.chinese: 它们被还原为自我关心的个人的同一或同质。

sentences.english: Kojève goes further and gives it substance as "a universal and homogeneous state."
sentences.chinese: 科耶夫将其进一步实在化为“普遍的同质的国家”。

definition: to mix up/to confuse one thing with another
mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic)/to repel one another
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
